720074f-a.text:
Grand Street, south side, east from West Broadway.
June 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
720074f-a.folder: Grand Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

724398f-a.text:
West Broadway, east side, south from Grand Street, to and across Wunal Street. Dominating the view is the New York Telephone Building. Note the 1-story wall enclosing the yard of the Railway Express Agency.
May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
724398f-a.folder: West Broadway & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

724401f-a.text:
West Broadway, west side, south from Grand Street, showing this thoroughfare subsequent to the 'El" demolition. Appearing prominently is St. Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church, separating the Hall from the Rectory. To the left is Canal Street and towards which the photographer is aporoaching in View 2. No. 3 shows solely the 1-story taxpayer at the S.W. corner of West Broadway and Grand Street. This has a 34 foot frontage on the latter thoroughfare and adjoins a pair of frame buildings that have brick fronts. These bear No's 45 and 43
Grand Street.
July 25, 1939
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr
724401f-a.folder: West Broadway & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

724403f-c.text:
West Broadway, (left) at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Grand Street, showing the 2-story Sapphire Hotel. To the right are several large loft structures. No. 2 is similar, while No. 3 shows a "Hotdog' vendor outlined against the junk shop and yard to the north of the corner. This site -is at the left of the preceding views.
May 19, 1939
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr
724403f-c.folder: West Broadway & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

724404f-a.text:
West Broadway, west side, south from Watts (also Broome), to Grand Street's. This photograph is taken immediately subsequent to the demolition of the Sixth Avenue "El" and shows the buildings lining this block frontage. To the extreme left argin appears a glimpse of St. Alphonsus R. C. Church. This
structure is to the south of Grand Street.
July 25, 1939
L. Sperr
724404f-a.folder: West Broadway & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720071f-a.text:
Grand Street, west from West Broadway, across Thompson Street and Sixth Ave. Extension (where angle is formed),to Varick Street which does not appear, same being across the face of the ten story white structure whose rear 1s seen across the roof of the American Wool Stock Company. The low (three and four story) structures shown beneath same are of frame construction with a brick front and bear Nos. 18 and 16 Grand Street, being at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Sixth Ave. Extension (formerly Sullivan Street at this point).
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
720071f-a.folder: Grand Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

724402f-b.text:
West Broadway, north from Grand Street, as viewed from the Sixth Ave. Elevated line station at this point. The towered structures in the background are: the Empire State Building, No. 1 Fifth Ave. and the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company Building, respectively, from left
to rigt.
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg e 79E1
The same location subsequent to "E1" demolition.
July 25, 1939
P. L. Sperr
724402f-b.folder: West Broadway & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY
